alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cameron County through 1145 PM CDT... At 1056 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Villa Nueva Elementary School, or near Rancho Viejo, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rancho Viejo, Southmost, Olmito, Port Of Brownsville, La Paloma, Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Brownsville, Lincoln Park and Longoria Elementary School. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 1 and 13. US Highway 281 between mile markers 824 and 830, and between mile markers 834 and 838. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Brownsville.
